intro: Ainsliaea henryi var. subalpina, commonly known as the Alpine Ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
